intro: Acineta mireyae, commonly known as the Mireyae's acineta, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions in South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy stems, adapting to its specific ecological niche. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in humid forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
